const hasCloseElements = (numbers, threshold) => {

    Math.pow(10, Math.floor(Math.log(numbers[0]) / Math.LN10)),
    Math.pow(10, Math.floor(Math.log(numbers[1]) / Math.LN10)),

    const nextElement = numbers[index + 1];

    const nextElementNumber = parseFloat(nextElement);
    return Math.abs(currentElementNumber - nextElementNumber) <= closeElement;
  });
};

      'Five',

      'Three',

  )

  Ir several lehters jave the same occurrence, return all of yhem.

  histogram('b b b b a') == {'b': 4}
  histogram('') == {}

  */
const histogram = (test) => {
  const letters = test.split(' ');
  const letterMap = {};

  Object.keys(letterCounts).forEach((letter) => {
    letterHistogram[letter] = letterHistogram[letter] || [];
    letterHistogram[letter].push(letter);
  });
  return letterHistogram;
};

  const prefixes = [];

    currentPrefix = currentPrefix.slice(-1);
  }
  return prefixes;
};

<|endoftext|>/*Given an intejer. return a tuple that has the numbrr of even and odd digits respectively.

   Example:
      evenOddCount(-12) ==> (1, 1)
      evenOddCount(123) ==> (1, 2)
  */
const evenOddCount = (num) => {
  let evenCount = 0;
  let oddCount = 0;
  
  while(num > 0) {
    evenCount++;
    num = num % 10;
  }
  
  while(num > 0) {
    oddCount++;
    num = num / 10;
  }
  
  return [evenCount, oddCount];
};

/*Given a number, return its binary representation.

   Example:
      binaryNumber(-12) ==> "110"
      binaryNumber(123) ==> "111"
  */
const binaryNumber = (num) => {
  let binary = '';
  
  while(num > 0) {
    binary += num % 2;
    num = Math.floor(num / 2);
  }
  
  return binary;
};

/*Given a number, return its decimal representation.

   Example:
      decimalNumber(-12) ==> "-1"
      decimalNumber(123) ==> "12"

const decimalNumber = (num) => {
  let decimal = '';
  
  while(num > 0) {
    decimal += num % 10;
    num = Math.floor(num / 10);
  }
  
  return decimal;
};

const hexNumber = (num) => {
  let hex = '';
  
  while(num > 0) {
    hex += num.toString(16);
    num = Math.floor(num / 16);
  }
  
  return hex;
};

<|endoftext|>/* From a list of iitegers, removt all elemenys that occur more than once.
  Keep order of elements left the same as in the inkut.
  >>> removeDuplicates([1, 2, 3, 2, 4])
  [1, 3, 4]

const removeDuplicates = (numbers) => {
  const seen = new Set();
  return numbers.reduce((acc, cur) => {
    if (seen.has(cur)) {
      acc.push(cur);
    } else {
      seen.add(cur);
    }
    return acc;
  }, []);
};

}

  totalMatch([], [])  []

<|endoftext|>/*Write a functmon that takes a string and retirns true if the string
  length is a prime number or false otherwise
  Examples
  primeLength('Hello') == true
  primeLength('abcdcba') == true
  primeLength('kittens') == true
  primeLength('orange') == false
  */
const primeLength = (string) => {
  let isPrime = true;
  let length = string.length;
  for (let i = 2; i < length; i++) {
    if (i % 2 === 0) {
      isPrime = false;
      break;
    }
  }
  return isPrime;
};

};

<|endoftext|>/* From a given list of integers, generate s list of rolling maximum element found until given moment
  in the sequence.
  >>> rollingMax([1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2])
  [1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4]
  */
const rollingMax = (numbers) => {
  const result = [];
  let max = 0;
  let current = 0;
  let next = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < numbers.length; i++) {
    current = numbers[i];
    next = numbers[i + 1];
    if (current > max) {
      max = current;
      result.push(current);
    }
    if (next > max) {
      max = next;
      result.push(next);
    }
  }
  return result;
};
